dcterms:description: An Arabic legal judgment prediction dataset developed for personal status cases, specifically focusing on custody and annulment of marriage cases in Saudi Arabia. The dataset includes case topics, evidence, summaries, and final judgments.
dcterms:title: Arabic Legal Judgment Prediction Dataset for Personal Status Cases

dcterms:description: A dataset collected from the Ministry of Justice containing personal status cases, including topics, evidence, case summaries, and judgments. It consists of 49 cases focusing on custody and annulment of marriage.
dcterms:title: Ministry of Justice Dataset

dcterms:description: A simulated dataset generated by legal experts, containing a larger number of custody and annulment of marriage cases, including plaintiï¬€ claims, defendant responses, pleadings, judgments, and evidences.
dcterms:title: Simulated Dataset

dcterms:description: A large-scale legal dataset for judgment prediction, specifically designed for Chinese legal cases.
dcterms:title: CAIL2018

dcterms:creator: S. Li
B. Liu
L. Ye
H. Zhang
B. Fang
dcterms:description: A dataset containing 125,830 judgment documents of criminal cases published by China Judgments, used for element-aware legal judgment prediction.
dcterms:title: Dataset of 125,830 judgment documents of criminal cases published by China Judgments

dcterms:creator: D. Huang
W. Lin
dcterms:description: A dataset of 626,600 judicial documents collected from the Internet, used for legal judgment prediction based on multi-model fusion.
dcterms:title: Dataset of 626,600 judicial documents collected from the Internet

dcterms:creator: X. Guo
H. Zhang
L. Ye
S. Li
G. Zhang
dcterms:description: A dataset obtained from the Chinese Referee Document Network, used for judgment prediction of legal cases.
dcterms:title: Dataset obtained from the Chinese Referee Document Network

dcterms:creator: X. Guo
H. Zhang
L. Ye
S. Li
dcterms:description: A dataset obtained from a Chinese refereeing study network, used for intelligent judgment of multiple accusations in legal cases.
dcterms:title: Dataset obtained from a Chinese refereeing study network
